entry.title: The Spectral Theory of Tensors (Rough Version)
entry.summary: This is a survey of the spectral theory of tensors.

entry.title: Fredholm theory of the linearized ${\bar \partial}$-operator and additivity of its index
entry.summary: In this paper, we established Fredholm theory of the linearized ${{\bar \partial}}$-operator and studied the additivity of its index.

entry.title: Discrete Nodal Domain Theorems
entry.summary: We give a detailed proof for two discrete analogues of Courant's Nodal Domain Theorem.

entry.title: On a theorem of Kac and Gilbert
entry.summary: We prove a general operator theoretic result that asserts that many multiplicity two selfadjoint operators have simple singular spectrum.

entry.title: Orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle: New results
entry.summary: We announce numerous new results in the theory of orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle.

entry.title: OPUC on One Foot
entry.summary: We present an expository introduction to orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle.

entry.title: CMV matrices: Five years after
entry.summary: CMV matrices are the unitary analog of Jacobi matrices; we review their general theory.

entry.title: L^2-spectral invariants and convergent sequences of finite graphs
entry.summary: Using the spectral theory of weakly convergent sequences of finite graphs, we prove the uniform existence of the integrated density of states for a large class of infinite graphs.

entry.title: Borg type uniqueness Theorems for periodic Jacobi operators with matrix valued coefficients
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of Borg type uniqueness Theorems for periodic Jacobi operators with matrix valued coefficients.

entry.title: Schrodinger Operators with Purely Discrete Spectrum
entry.summary: We prove $-\Delta +V$ has purely discrete spectrum if $V\geq 0$ and, for all $M$, $|\{x\mid V(x)<M\}|<\infty$ and various extensions.

entry.title: On the spectral estimates for the Schrödinger operator on $\Z^d,\ d\ge3$
entry.summary: For the discrete Schr\"odinger operator we obtain sharp estimates for the number of negative eigenvalues.

entry.title: Une vue panoramique sur l'analyse semi-classique
entry.summary: In this article we give a panoramic view on semi-classical analysis.

entry.title: On the completeness of generalized eigenfunctions of elliptic cone operators
entry.summary: We show the completeness of the system of generalized eigenfunctions of closed extensions of elliptic cone operators under suitable conditions on the symbols.

entry.title: Erratum for: Inverse Spectral Theory for a Singular Sturm-Liouville Operator on [0,1]
entry.summary: This is a correction to our article in the Journal of Differential Equations, Volume 76(1988).

entry.title: Singular spectral shift is additive
entry.summary: In this note it is shown that for trace-class perturbations of self-adjoint operators the singular part of the spectral shift function is additive.

entry.title: PT symmetry and Weyl asymptotics
entry.summary: For a class of PT-symmetric operators with small random perturbations, the eigenvalues obey Weyl asymptotics with probability close to 1. Consequently, when the principal symbol is non-real, there are many non-real eigenvalues.

entry.title: Scattering theory for Hamiltonians periodic in time
entry.summary: Old paper on the abstract scattering theory (ST) of periodic Hamiltonians. Updating of the references and correction of some minor non-mathematical misprints by H.C. Rosu.

entry.title: Remling's Theorem on canonical systems
entry.summary: We prove the Remling's Theorem on canonical systems and discuss the connection between Jacobi and Schr\"odinger equation and canonical systems.

entry.title: Absolutely continuous spectrum for quasi-periodic Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: I prove that quasi-periodic Schr\"odinger operators in arbitrary dimension have some absolutely continuous spectrum.

entry.title: On Pleijel's nodal domain theorem
entry.summary: A slight improvement of Pleijel's estimate on the number of nodal domains is obtained, exploiting a refinement of the Faber-Krahn inequality and packing density of discs.

entry.title: On the numerical radii of $2\times2$ complex matrices
entry.summary: The numerical radius of the general $2\times2$ complex matrix is calculated.

entry.title: On matrices with $Q^2$-scalings
entry.summary: We provide a counterexample to some statements dealing with a sufficient property for the square of a matrix to be a $P_0^+$ -matrix.

entry.title: Canonical systems and de Branges spaces
entry.summary: This is an exposition of the inverse spectral theory of canonical systems based on de Branges spaces of entire functions

entry.title: Large bi-diagonal matrices and random perturbations
entry.summary: This is a first paper by the authors dedicated to the distribution of eigenvalues for random perturbations of large bidiagonal Toeplitz matrices.

entry.title: Inverse scattering on the line for the matrix Sturm-Liouville equation
entry.summary: The inverse scattering problem is studied for the matrix Sturm-Liouville equation on the line. Necessary and sufficient conditions for the scattering data are obtained.

entry.title: Spectral Expansion for the Asymptotically Spectral Periodic Differential Operators
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the spectral expansion for the asymptotically spectral differential operators generated in all real line by ordinary differential expression of arbitrary order with periodic matrix-valued coefficients

entry.title: Analytic torsion of finite volume hyperbolic orbifolds
entry.summary: In this article we define the analytic torsion of finite volume orbifolds $\Gamma \backslash \mathbb{H}^{2n+1}$ and study its asymptotic behavior with respect to certain rays of representations.

entry.title: A Note on The Multidimensional Moment Problem
entry.summary: In this note, we show that if a multidimensional sequence generates Hankel tensors and all the Hankel matrices, generated by this sequence, are positive semi-definite, then this sequence is a multidimensional moment sequence.

entry.title: The Group Inverse of extended Symmetric and Periodic Jacobi Matrices
entry.summary: In this work, we explicitly compute the group inverse of symmetric and periodic Jacobi matrices.

entry.title: Heat content determines planar triangles
entry.summary: We prove that heat content determines planar triangles.

entry.title: Spectral Theory Sum Rules, Meromorphic Herglotz Functions and Large Deviations
entry.summary: Short blurb for invited talk at AMS annual meeting in Atlanta; will appear in January AMS Notices

entry.title: Holomorphic extension of the de Gennes function
entry.summary: This note is devoted to prove that the de Gennes function has a holomorphic extension on a strip containing the real axis.

entry.title: On one approach to definition of singular differential operators
entry.summary: In terms of triples of Banach spaces, we define a large class of boundary problems for ordinary differential equations (of arbitrary order) with singular coefficients.

entry.title: Davies-Gaffney-Grigor'yan lemma on simplicial complexes
entry.summary: We prove Davies-Gaffney-Grigor'yan lemma for heat kernels of bounded discrete Hodge Laplacians on simplicial complexes.

entry.title: Selberg zeta function and hyperbolic eisenstein series
entry.summary: We study the product of Selberg Zeta function and hyperbolic Eisenstein series on a family of degenerating hyperbolic surfaces.

entry.title: Stability of Quadratic Projection Methods
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss the stability of an alternative pollution-free procedure for computing spectra. The main difference with the Galerkin method lies in the fact that it gives rise to a weak approximate problem which is quadratic in the spectral parameter, instead of linear. Previous accounts on this new procedure can be found in Levitin and Shargorodsky (2002) [math.SP/0212087] and Boulton (2006) [math.SP/0503126].
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, 4 figures. In this updated version we have made a small number of minor corrections

entry.title: Absence of Cantor spectrum for a class of Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: It is shown that the complete localization of eigenvectors for the almost Mathieu operator entails the absence of Cantor spectrum for this operator.

entry.title: Spectrum of compact manifolds with high genus
entry.summary: In this paper we study the behavior of the spectrum of a compact, connected Riemannian manifold $(M,g)$ of dimension $d \ge 2$, when we add an increasing number of increasingly small handles. No assumptions on any of the curvatures are needed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 33 pages. Submitted to Israel J. Math

entry.title: Growth and spectrum of diffusions
entry.summary: We prove an upper bound on the bottom of the essential spectrum of a diffusion in term of the growth of the volume of $X$, generalizing a result by R. Brooks.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMSLaTeX file, 17 pages. Submitted to Comm. PDE

entry.title: A note on one inverse spectral problem
entry.summary: The note contains the proof of the uniqueness theorem for the inverse problem in the case of $n$-th order differential equation.

entry.title: On The Eigenvalues of Some Vectorial Sturm-Liouville Eigenvalue Problems
entry.summary: The author tries to derive the asymptotic expression of the large eigevalues of some vectorial Sturm-Liouville differential equations. A precise description for the formula of the square root of the large eiegnvalues up to the $O(1/n)$-term is obtained.

entry.title: On the Construction of Isospectral Vectorial Sturm-Liouville Differential Equations
entry.summary: The author extends the idea of Jodeit and Levitan for constructing isospectral problems of the classical scalar Sturm-Liouville differential equations to the vectorial Sturm-Liouville differential equations. Some interesting relations are found.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, latex, no figures, revised version

entry.title: The spectral shift function and the invariance principle
entry.summary: The new representation formula for the spectral shift function due to F.Gesztesy and K.A.Makarov is considered. This formula is extended to the case of relatively trace class perturbations.

entry.title: Exponentially decaying eigenvectors for certain almost periodic operators
entry.summary: For certain one-dimensional Schroedinger-type difference operators with a complex potential, a "complete" set of exponentially decaying eigenvectors is shown to exist. "Completeness" entails that the parameters involved are obtained through evaluation of analytic functions on a Riemann surface.

entry.title: The Pseudospectral Properties of non-self-adjoint Schrödinger Operators in the semi-classical limit
entry.summary: We describe the general qualitative behaviour of the resolvent norm for a very wide class of non-self-adjoint Schroedinger operators in the semi-classical regime, as the spectral parameter varies over the complex plane.

entry.title: Periodic points of quasianalytic Hamiltonian billiards
entry.summary: We study absolutely periodic points and trajectories of Hamiltonian systems. Our main result is a necessary and sufficient for a Hamiltonian system to have the following property: if there exists one absolutely periodic trajectory then all trajectories are periodic with the same period.

entry.title: Birkhoff Normal Forms in Semi-Classical Inverse Problems
entry.summary: We apply recent results on semi-classical trace formulae and on Birkhoff normal forms for semi-classical Fourier integral operators to a wide range of semi-classical and high energy spectral inverse problems.

entry.title: Some upper bounds on the number of resonances for manifolds with infinite cylindrical ends
entry.summary: We prove some sharp upper bounds on the number of resonances associated with the Laplacian, or Laplacian plus potential, on a manifold with infinite cylidrical ends.

entry.title: Asymptotic behaviour of quasi-orthogonal polynomials
entry.summary: We obtain explicit upper and lower bounds on the norms of the spectral projections of the non-self-adjoint harmonic oscillator. Some of our results apply to a variety of other families of orthogonal polynomials.

entry.title: Cayley-Hamilton Decomposition and Spectral Asymmetry
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due a crucial mistake due to a crucial mistake in the proof of Lemma 2.3.

entry.title: Sturm Oscillation and Comparison Theorems
entry.summary: This is a celebratory and pedagogical discussion of Sturm oscillation theory. Included is the discussion of the difference equation case via determinants and a renormalized oscillation theorem of Gesztesy, Teschl, and the author.

entry.title: Analogs of the M-Function in the Theory of Orthogonal Polynomials on the Unit Circle
entry.summary: We show that the multitude of applications of the Weyl-Titchmarsh m-function leads to a multitude of different functions in the theory of orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle that serve as analogs of the m-function.

entry.title: On the spectrum of the Laplace-Beltrami operator for p-forms on asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds
entry.summary: Under suitable conditions on the asymptotic decay of the metric, we compute the essential spectrum of the Laplace-Beltrami operator acting on $p$-forms on asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Rend. Accad. Naz. Sci. XL Mem. Math. Appl. (2002) Vol. XXVI Fasc.1, 115-144

entry.title: Eigenfunctions for partially rectangular billiards
entry.summary: In this note we further develop the idea of using a ``black box'' point of view (see our previous work) to study eigenfunctions for billiards which have rectangular components: they include the Bunimovich billiard, the Sinai billiard, and the recently popular pseudointegrable billiards

entry.title: Elementary linear algebra for advanced spectral problems
entry.summary: We discuss the general method of Grushin problems, closely related to Shur complements, Feshbach projections and effective Hamiltonians, and describe various appearances in spectral theory, pdes, mathematical physics and numerical problems.

entry.title: On Weyl-Titchmarsh Theory for Singular Finite Difference Hamiltonian Systems
entry.summary: We develop the basic theory of matrix-valued Weyl-Titchmarsh M-functions and the associated Green's matrices for whole-line and half-line self-adjoint Hamiltonian finite difference systems with separated boundary conditions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 30 pages, to appear in J. Comput. Appl. Math

entry.title: Generalized scattering phases for asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds
entry.summary: We define scattering phases associated to pairs of Laplacians on asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds, and prove some spectral asymptotics for them. These result are applications of Isozaki-Kitada's constructions which we adapt to this framework.

entry.title: Boundary spectral behaviour for semiclassical operators in one dimension
entry.summary: For a class of non-selfadjoint semiclassical operators in dimension one, we get a complete asymptotic description of all eigenvalues near a critical value of the leading symbol of the operator on the boundary of the pseudospectrum.

entry.title: Lectures on scattering theory
entry.summary: The first two lectures are devoted to describing the basic concepts of scattering theory in a very compressed way. A detailed presentation of the abstract part can be found in \cite{I} and numerous applications in \cite{RS} and \cite{Y2}. The last two lectures are based on the recent research of the author.

entry.title: Inverse problem for one class of nonselfadjoint operator's bunches with nonperiodic coefficients
entry.summary: In this paper the complete spectral analysis of the operators is carried out and also with help of generalized normalizing numbers the inverse problem is solved.

entry.title: Necessary and sufficient conditions for the inverse problem of one class ordinary differential operators with complex periodic coefficients
entry.summary: The basic purpose of the present paper is the full solutions of the inverse problem (i.e. a finding of necessary and sufficient conditions) for the operator with complex periodic coefficients.

entry.title: On location of discrete spectrum for complex Jacobi matrices
entry.summary: We study spectrum inclusion regions for complex Jacobi matrices which are compact perturbations of the discrete laplacian. The condition sufficient for the lack of discrete spectrum for such matrices is given.

author.name: I. Egorova
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Low Temperature Physics, Kharkiv, Ukraine

author.name: L. Golinskii
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Low Temperature Physics, Kharkiv, Ukraine

entry.title: Time-Dependent Solutions of a Discrete Schrodinger's Equation
entry.summary: By substituting the diagonal and the other two adjacent diagonals terms with two different functions depending on two parameters of the discrete Laplacian operator, the nature of its spectrum changes from being purely continuous to partially continuous. We present the existence of three isolated eigenvalues by altering those two parameters.

entry.title: Remarks on a paper of Geronimo and Johnson
entry.summary: We present a point of view on results of the paper of Geronimo and Johnson [Comm. Math, Phys. 193 (1998)] that allow infinitely dimensional generalization up to the case when spectrum is supported on a Cantor set of positive Lebesgue measure.

entry.title: Limit periodic Jacobi matrices with a prescribed p-adic hull and a singularly continuous spectrum
entry.summary: In this work we build a certain machine that allows to construct almost periodic Jacobi matrices with singularly continuous spectrum a prescribed p-adic hull.

entry.title: The characterization problem for one class high order ordinary differential operators with periodic coefficients
entry.summary: The main purpose of the present work is solving the characterization problem which consist of identification of necessary and sufficient conditions on the scattering data ensuring that the reconstructed potential belongs to a particular class

entry.title: On the fundamental eigenvalue ratio of the p-Laplacian
entry.summary: It is shown that the fundamental eigenvalue ratio \lambda_2 / \lambda_1 of the p-Laplacian is bounded by a quantity depending only on the dimension N and p.

entry.title: Verblunsky Coefficients With Coulomb-Type Decay
entry.summary: We show that probability measures on the unit circle associated with Verblunsky coefficients obeying a Coulomb-type decay estimate have no singular continuous component.

entry.title: The discrete spectrum for complex perturbations of periodic Jacobi matrices
entry.summary: We study spectrum inclusion regions for complex Jacobi matrices which are compact perturbations of real periodic Jacobi matrices. The condition sufficient for the lack of discrete spectrum for such matrices is given

entry.title: Fractal upper bounds on the density of semiclassical resonances
entry.summary: For semiclassical problems we establish upper bounds on the number of resonances in boxes of size $h$ along the real axis, in terms of the dimension of the set of trapped trajectories. The proof uses second microlocalization.

entry.title: On one inverse problem relatively domain for the plate
entry.summary: Inverse problem relatively domain for the plate under across vibrations is considered. The definition of s-functions is interoduced. The construction for defining of the domain of the plate by given s-functions is offered.

entry.title: Asymptotics of resonances for a schrodinger operator with matrix values
entry.summary: we obtain the asympotics for the counting function of resonances for a matrix valued schrodinger operator in dimension one.

entry.title: Determinants of zeroth order operators
entry.summary: We show that the Szego regularized determinant of a zeroth order operator differs from the zeta regularized determinant of the same operator by a local term. In addition, we compute multiplicative anomalies for the zeta regularized determinant.

entry.title: Rank one perturbations and the zeros of paraorthogonal polynomials on the unit circle
entry.summary: We prove several results about zeros of paraorthogonal polynomials using the theory of rank one perturbations of unitary operators. In particular, we obtain new details on the interlacing of zeros for successive POPUC.

entry.title: Eigenfunction expansions associated with 1d periodic differential operators of order $2n$
entry.summary: We prove an explicit formula for the spectral expansions in $L^2(\R)$ generated by selfadjoint differential operators $$ (-1)^n\frac{d^{2n}}{dx^{2n}}+\sum\limits_{j=0}^{n-1}\frac{d^{j}}{dx^{j}} p_j(x)\frac{d^{j}}{dx^{j}},\quad p_j(x+\pi)=p_j(x),\quad x\in\R. $$

entry.title: A note on circular trace formulae
entry.summary: We find a finite CMV matrix whose eigenvalues coincide with the Dirichlet data of a circular periodic problem. As a consequence, we obtain circular analogues of the classical trace formulae for periodic Jacobi matrices.

entry.title: Parametrization of the isospectral set for the vector-valued Sturm-Liouville problem
entry.summary: We obtain a parametrization of the isospectral set of matrix-valued potentials for the vector-valued Sturm-Liouville problem on a finite interval.

entry.title: Sum rules and spectral measures of Schrodinger operators with L^2 potentials
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions are presented for a positive measure to be the spectral measure of a half-line Schrodinger operator with square integrable potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Annals of Math

entry.title: Localization for the Anderson Model on Trees with Finite Dimensions
entry.summary: We introduce a family of trees that interpolate between the Bethe lattice and $\bbZ$. We prove complete localization for the Anderson model on any member of that family.

entry.title: Remark on the paper "Asymptotic behavior of polynomials orthonormal on a homogeneous set"
entry.summary: Minor modifications are given to prove the Main Theorem under the Blaschke (instead of Carleson) condition as well as a small historical comment.

entry.title: Eigenvalues of Sturm Liouville problems with discontinuity conditions inside a finite interval
entry.summary: In this work, we use the \textit{regularized sampling method} to compute the eigenvalues of Sturm Liouville problems with discontinuity conditions inside a finite interval. We work out an example by computing a few eigenvalues and their corresponding eigenfunctions.

entry.title: Classification of Ramification Systems for Symmetric Groups
entry.summary: We obtain the formula computing the number of isomorphic classes of ramification systems with characters over group $S_n$ ($n \not=6$) and their representatives.

entry.title: Stability of Spectral Types for Jacobi Matrices Under Decaying Random Perturbations
entry.summary: We study stability of spectral types for semi-infinite self-adjoint tridiagonal matrices under random decaying perturbations. We show that absolutely continuous spectrum associated with bounded eigenfunctions is stable under Hilbert-Schmidt random perturbations. We also obtain some results for singular spectral types.

entry.title: Exponential decay of eigenfunctions of first order systems
entry.summary: For first order systems, we obtain an efficient bound on the exponential decay of an eigenfunction in terms of the distance between the corresponding eigenvalue and the essential spectrum. As an example, the Dirac operator is considered.

entry.title: An Indefinite Convection-Diffusion Operator
entry.summary: We give a mathematically rigorous analysis which confirms the surprising results in a recent paper of Benilov, O'Brien and Sazonov about the spectrum of a highly singular non-self-adjoint operator that arises in a problem in fluid mechanics.

entry.title: Differences of spectral projections and scattering matrix
entry.summary: In the scattering theory framework, we point out a connection between the spectrum of the scattering matrix of two operators and the spectrum of the difference of spectral projections of these operators.

entry.title: The spectra of the spherical and euclidean triangle groups
entry.summary: We derive the spectrum of the Laplace-Beltrami operator on the quotient orbifold of the non hyperbolic triangle groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted in the Journal of the Australian Mathematical Society
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of the Australian Mathematical Society, 84 (2008), 217--227

entry.title: Asymptotics for eigenvalues of a non-linear integral system
entry.summary: We show the asymptotic behavior of the eigenvalues of the non-linear integral system related to the (p,q)-Laplacian.

entry.title: On the Spectrum of the Dirichlet Laplacian in a Narrow Strip
entry.summary: We derive a two-terms asymptotics for eigenvalues of the Dirichlet Laplacian in a narrow strip of variable width. The asymptotics is taken with respect to a small paprameter that characterizes the width of the strip.

entry.title: Fourier method for one dimensional Schrödinger operators with singular periodic potentials
entry.summary: By using quasi--derivatives, we develop a Fourier method for studying the spectral properties of one dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with periodic singular potentials.

entry.title: The spectral flow, the Fredholm index, and the spectral shift function
entry.summary: We discuss the well known ``Fredholm index=spectral flow'' theorem and show that it can be interpreted as a limit case of an identity involving two spectral shift functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to M.Sh.Birman's 80th birthday issue of Trans. AMS

entry.title: An Indefinite Convection-Diffusion Operator With Real Spectrum
entry.summary: We confirm rigorously the conjecture, based on numerical and asymptotic evidence, that all the eigenvalues of a certain non-self-adjoint operator are real.

entry.title: On Perturbations of Quasiperiodic Schroedinger Operators
entry.summary: Using relative oscillation theory and the reducibility result of Eliasson, we study perturbations of quasiperiodic Schroedinger operators. In particular, we derive relative oscillation criteria and eigenvalue asymptotics for critical potentials.

entry.title: Regularity and the Cesaro-Nevai class
entry.summary: We consider OPRL and OPUC with measures regular in the sense of Ullman-Stahl-Totik and prove consequences on the Jacobi parameters or Verblunsky coefficients. For example, regularity on $[-2,2]$ implies $\lim_{N\to\infty} N^{-1} [\sum_{n=1}^N (a_n-1)^2 + b_n^2] =0$.

entry.title: Bethe-Sommerfeld Conjecture
entry.summary: We consider Schroedinger operator $-\Delta+V$ in $R^d$ ($d\ge 2$) with smooth periodic potential $V$ and prove that there are only finitely many gaps in its spectrum.
entry.arxiv:comment: 59 pages, 10 figures; to appear in Annales Henri Poincare

entry.title: Spectral Properties of Matrices Associated with Some Directed Graphs
entry.summary: We study the spectral properties of certain non-self-adjoint matrices associated with large directed graphs. Asymptotically the eigenvalues converge to certain curves, apart from a finite number that have limits not on these curves.

entry.title: On the distribution of eigenvalues of non-selfadjoint operators
entry.summary: We prove quantitative bounds on the eigenvalues of non-selfadjoint bounded and unbounded operators. We use the perturbation determinant to reduce the problem to one of studying the zeroes of a holomorphic function.

entry.title: Almost Periodic Szegő Cocycles with Uniformly Positive Lyapunov Exponents
entry.summary: We exhibit examples of almost periodic Verblunsky coefficients for which Herman's subharmonicity argument applies and yields that the associated Lyapunov exponents are uniformly bounded away from zero.

entry.title: About Substitution Tilings with Statistical Circular Symmetry
entry.summary: Two results about equidistribution of tile orientations in primitive substitution tilings are stated, one for finitely many, one for infinitely many orientations. Furthermore, consequences for the associated diffraction spectra and the dynamical systems are discussed.

entry.title: Geodesics on weighted projective spaces
entry.summary: We study the inverse spectral problem for weighted projective spaces using wave-trace methods. We show that in many cases one can "hear" the weights of a weighted projective space.

entry.title: Geometric and spectral properties of locally tessellating planar graphs
entry.summary: In this article, we derive bounds for values of the global geometry of locally tessellating planar graphs, namely, the Cheeger constant and exponential growth, in terms of combinatorial curvatures. We also discuss spectral implications for the Laplacians.

entry.title: Bounded Sobolev Norms for Linear Schrödinger Equations Under Resonant Perturbations
entry.summary: We prove that the Sobolev norm for a 1-D periodic Schroedinger equation remain bounded under small resonant perturbations.

entry.title: Bi-isometries and commutant lifting
entry.summary: A new functional model for pairs of commuting isometries is described. Intertwining operators between such models are then studied in order to approach the classification of invariant subspaces of such pairs.

entry.title: Inverse Nodal Problems
entry.summary: It is shown that nodal sequences determine the underlying manifold up to scaling within classes of rectangles with Dirichlet boundary conditions, separable two dimensional tori, two-dimensional flat Klein bottles and flat tori in two and three dimensions.

entry.title: On Factorization of a Perturbation of a J-selfadjoint Operator Arising in Fluid Dynamics
entry.summary: We prove that some perturbation of a J-selfadjoint second order differential operator admits factorization and use this new representation of the operator to prove compactness of its resolvent and to find its domain.

entry.title: Eigenvalue distribution for non-self-adjoint operators on compact manifolds with small multiplicative random perturbations
entry.summary: In this work we extend a previous work about the Weyl asymptotics of the distribution of eigenvalues of non-self-adjoint differential operators with small multiplicative random perturbations, by treating the case of operators on compact manifolds

entry.title: Decomposing the Essential Spectrum
entry.summary: We use C*-algebra theory to provide a new method of decomposing the eseential spectra of self-adjoint and non-self-adjoint Schrodinger operators in one or more space dimensions.

entry.title: Infinite Hankel Block Matrices, Extremal Problems
entry.summary: In this paper we use the matrix analogue of eigenvalue $\rho_{min}^{2}$ to formulate and to solve the extremal Nehary problem. When $\rho_{min}$ is a scalar, our approach coincides with Adamjan-Arov-Krein approach.

entry.title: On the concentration-compactness phenomenon for the first Schrodinger eigenvalue
entry.summary: We study a variational problem for the first Schrodinger eigenvalue on closed Riemannian surfaces. More precisely, we explore concentration-compactness properties of sequences formed by its extremal potentials.

entry.title: Optimality of log Hölder continuity of the integrated density of states
entry.summary: We construct examples, that log H\"older continuity of the integrated density of states cannot be improved. Our examples are limit-periodic.

entry.title: Multiple operator integrals and spectral shift
entry.summary: Multiple scalar integral representations for traces of operator derivatives are obtained and applied in the proof of existence of the higher order spectral shift functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, to appear in Illinois J. Math

entry.title: A local Szegö-type theorem in Toeplitz quantization
entry.summary: A Szeg\"o-type theorem for Toeplitz operators was proved by Boutet de Monvel and Guillemin for general Toeplitz structures. We give a local version of this result in the setting of positive line bundles on compact symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: On the weak and ergodic limit of the spectral shift function
entry.summary: We discuss convergence properties of the spectral shift functions associated with a pair of Schrodinger operators with Dirichlet boundary conditions at the end points of a finite interval (0, r) as the length of interval approaches infinity.

entry.title: The regularized trace formula for the Sturm-Liouville equation with spectral parameter in the boundary conditions
entry.summary: The regularized trace formula of first order for the Sturm-Liouville equation with spectral parameter in the boundary conditions is obtained.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Inst. Math. Mech. Natl. Acad. Sci. Azerb., 22 (2005) 99-102

entry.title: Inverse spectral theory as influenced by Barry Simon
entry.summary: We survey Barry Simon's principal contributions to the field of inverse spectral theory in connection with one-dimensional Schrodinger and Jacobi operators.

entry.title: Ternary algebras with braided statistics
entry.summary: Algebraic relations that characterize quantum statistics (Bose-Einstein statistic, Fermi-Dirac statistic, supersymmetry, parastatistic, anyonic statistic, ...) are reformulated herein in terms of a new algebraic structure, which we call para-algebra.

entry.title: Spectral properties of discrete alloy-type models
entry.summary: We discuss recent results on spectral properties of discrete alloy-type random Schr\"odinger operators. They concern Wegner estimates and bounds on the fractional moments of the Green's function.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Proceedings of ICMP 2009 (Prague)

entry.title: A constructive version of the Boyle-Handelman theorem on the spectra of nonnegative matrices
entry.summary: A constructive version of the celebrated Boyle-Handelman theorem on the non-zero spectra of nonnegative matrices is presented.

entry.title: An integer-valued version of the Birman-Krein formula
entry.summary: We discuss an identity in abstract scattering theory which can be interpreted as an integer-valued version of the Birman-Krein formula.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Latex. To appear in the M.Sh.Birman memorial issue of Functional Analysis and Its Applications

entry.title: Algebraic aspects of spectral theory
entry.summary: We describe some aspects of spectral theory that involve algebraic considerations but need no analysis. Some of the important applications of the results are to the algebra of $n\times n$ matrices with entries that are polynomials or more general analytic functions.

entry.title: On the spectrum of skew-shift Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: I prove that the spectrum of a skew-shift Schr\"odinger operator contains larges interval in the semi-classical regime. In the semi-classical limit, these intervals approach the range of the potential.

entry.title: The semiclassical limit of eigenfunctions of the Schrödinger equation and the Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization condition, revisited
entry.summary: Consider the semiclassical limit, as the Planck constant $\hbar\ri 0$, of bound states of a quantum particle in a one-dimensional potential well. We justify the semiclassical asymptotics of eigenfunctions and recover the Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization condition.

entry.title: Connectivity and Minimal Distance Spectral Radius of Graphs
entry.summary: In this paper, we study how the distance spectral radius behaves when the graph is perturbed by grafting edges. As applications, we also determine the graph with $k$ cut vertices (respectively, $k$ cut edges) with the minimal distance spectral radius.

entry.title: A sequence of zero modes of Weyl-Dirac operators and an associated sequence of solvable polynomials
entry.summary: It is shown that a series of solvable polynomials is attached to the series of zero modes constructed by Adam, Muratori and Nash \cite{AdamMuratoriNash1

entry.title: On the formula of regularized traces
entry.summary: We obtain a new simple formula for the regularized traces of singular ordinary differential operators.

entry.title: On the spectra of generalized Fibonacci and Fibonacci-like operators
entry.summary: We analyze the spectra of generalized Fibonacci and Fibonacci-like operators in Banach space $l^1$. Some of the results have application in population dynamics.

entry.title: Lieb-Thirring inequalities on some manifolds
entry.summary: We prove Lieb-Thirring inequalities with improved constants on the two-dimensional sphere and the two-dimensional torus. In the one-dimensional periodic case we obtain a simultaneous bound for the negative trace and the number of negative eigenvalues.

entry.title: Remark on Spectral Rigidity for Magnetic Schrödinger Operators
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of Guillemin's theorem on the determination of the magnetic field on the torus by the spectrum of the corresponding Schr\"odinger operator.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Operator Theory: Advances and Applications, Vol. 191, 323-329 (2009) Birkh\"auser Verlag Basl/Switzerland

entry.title: On Hankel-type operators with discontinuous symbols in higher dimensions
entry.summary: We obtain an asymptotic formula for the counting function of the discrete spectrum for Hankel-type pseudo-differential operators with discontinuous symbols.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin London Mathematical Society Volume 44 (2012) Issue 3 Pp. 496-502

entry.title: Asymptotics of spectral quantities of Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: In this paper we provide new asymptotic estimates of the Floquet exponents of Schr\"odinger operators on the circle. By the same techniques, known asymptotic estimates of various others spectral quantities are improved.

entry.title: The asymptotics of the Ray-Singer analytic torsion for compact hyperbolic manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper we study the asymptotic behavior of the analytic torsion for compact, oriented hyperbolic manifolds with respect to certain rays of representations obtained by restriction of irreducible representations of the group of isometries of the hyperbolic space

entry.title: On the essential spectrum of magnetic Schroedinger operators in exterior domains
entry.summary: We establish equality between the essential spectrum of the Schroedinger operator with magnetic field in the exterior of a compact arbitrary dimensional domain and that of the operator defined in all the space, and discuss applications of this equality.

entry.title: Resolvent estimates for elliptic quadratic differential operators
entry.summary: Sharp resolvent bounds for non-selfadjoint semiclassical elliptic quadratic differential operators are established, in the interior of the range of the associated quadratic symbol.

entry.title: Eigenvalues in gaps of selfadjoint operators in Pontryagin spaces
entry.summary: Given an open real interval \Delta\ and two selfadjoint operators A_1, A_2 in a \Pi_\kappa-space with n-dimensional resolvent difference we show that the difference of the total multiplicities of the eigenvalues of A_1 and A_2 in \Delta\ is at most n+2\kappa.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Eisenstein series for geometrically finite hyperbolic surfaces of infinite volume
entry.summary: For a geometrically finite hyperbolic surface of infinite volume we write down the spectral decomposition for the Laplacian on 1-forms, generalize the Kudla and Millson's construction of hyperbolic Eisenstein series and other related results.

entry.title: Scattering theory for Schrödinger operators on steplike, almost periodic infinite-gap backgrounds
entry.summary: We develop direct scattering theory for one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with steplike potentials, which are asymptotically close to different Bohr almost periodic infinite-gap potentials on different half-axes.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:0707.4632

entry.title: Eigenfunctions and Nodal Sets
entry.summary: This is a survey of recent results on eigenfunctions of the Laplacian on compact Riemannian manifolds and their nodal sets. It is the write-up of my talk at JDG 2011.
entry.arxiv:comment: 60 pages, 5 figures lifted from the web. Comments appreciated
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Surveys in Differential Geometry volume 18 (2013), pp. 237-308

entry.title: Maximization of the second conformal eigenvalue of spheres
entry.summary: We establish in this paper an upper bound on the second eigenvalue of n-dimensional spheres in the conformal class of the round sphere. This upper bound holds in all dimensions and is asymptotically sharp as the dimension increases.

entry.title: Multiplicity of the lowest eigenvalue of non-commuatative harmonic oscillators
entry.summary: The multiplicity of the lowest eigenvalue E of the so-called non-commutative harmonic oscillator Q(\alpha,\beta) is studied. It is shown that E is simple for \alpha and \beta in some region.

entry.title: Spectral asymptotics for magnetic Schrödinger operators in domains with corners
entry.summary: This paper is on magnetic Schrodinger operators in two dimensional domains with corners. Semiclassical formulas are obtained for the sum and number of eigenvalues. The obtained results extend former formulas for smooth domains in \cite{Fr, FK} to piecewise smooth domains.

entry.title: Exponential dynamical localization for the almost Mathieu operator
entry.summary: We prove that the exponential moments of the position operator stay bounded for the supercritical almost Mathieu operator with Diophantine frequency.

entry.title: The spectral theory of the Fourier operator truncated on the positive half-axis
entry.summary: The spectral analysis of the operator Fourier truncated on the positive half-axis is done.
entry.arxiv:comment: 88 pages. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:0905.3996

entry.title: Combinatorial identities related to eigenfunction decompositions of Hill operators: Open Questions
entry.summary: We formulate several open questions related to enumerative combinatorics, which arise in the spectral analysis of Hill operators with trigonometric polynomial potentials.

entry.title: Asymptotics of the Eigenvalues of Two-Diagonal Jacobi Matrices
entry.summary: We compute the asymptotics of eigenvalues of Jacobi matrices with the zero coefficients on the main diagonal and the off-diagonal coefficients which converge to zero.

entry.title: On Properties of the Sturm-Liouville Operator with Degenerate Boundary Conditions
entry.summary: We consider spectral problems for the Sturm-Liouville operator with arbitrary complex-valued potential q(x) and degenerate boundary conditions. We solve corresponding inverse problem, and also study the completeness property and the basis property of the root function system.

entry.title: On a conjecture for higher-order Szego theorems
entry.summary: We disprove a conjecture of Simon for higher-order Szego theorems for orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle and propose a modified version of the conjecture.

entry.title: Global estimates of resonances for 1D Dirac operators
entry.summary: We discuss resonances for 1D massless Dirac operators with compactly supported potentials on the line. We estimate the sum of the negative power of all resonances in terms of the norm of the potential and the diameter of its support.

entry.title: Scattering theory and Banach space valued singular integrals
entry.summary: We give a new sufficient condition for existence and completeness of wave operators in abstract scattering theory. This condition generalises both trace class and smooth approaches to scattering theory. Our construction is based on estimates for the Cauchy transforms of operator valued measures.

entry.title: Spectral properties of Sturm-Liouville equations with singular energy-dependent potentials
entry.summary: We study spectral properties of energy-dependent Sturm-Liouville equations, introduce the notion of norming constants and establish their interrelation with the spectra. One of the main tools is the linearization of the problem in a suitable Pontryagin space.

entry.title: On the Simplicity of the Eigenvalues of the Non-self-adjoint Mathieu-Hill Operators
entry.summary: We find conditions on the potential of the non-self-adjoint Mathieu-Hill operator such that the all eigenvalues of the periodic, antiperiodic, Dirichlet and Neumann boundary value problems are simple.

entry.title: Krein's strings whose spectral functions are of polynomial growth
entry.summary: In the case of Krein's strings with spectral functions of polynomial growth a necessary and sufficient condition for the Krein's correspondence to be continuous is given.

entry.title: A priori bounds and existence of non-real eigenvalues of indefinite Sturm-Liouville problems
entry.summary: The present paper gives a priori bounds on the possible non-real eigenvalues of regular indefinite Sturm-Liouville problems and obtains sufficient conditions for such problems to admit non-real eigenvalues.

entry.title: Decay of eigenfunctions of elliptic PDE's
entry.summary: We study exponential decay of eigenfunctions of self-adjoint higher order elliptic operators on $\R^d$. We show that the possible critical decay rates are determined algebraically. In addition we show absence of super-exponentially decaying eigenfunctions and a refined exponential upper bound.

entry.title: Completeness of generalized transmission eigenstates
entry.summary: We prove the completeness of the generalized (interior) transmission eigenstates for the acoustic and Schr\"odinger equations. The method uses the ellipticity theory of Agranovich and Vishik.

entry.title: Improved Berezin-Li-Yau inequalities with magnetic field
entry.summary: In this paper we study the eigenvalue sums of Dirichlet Laplacians on bounded domains. Among our results we establish an improvement of the Li-Yau bound in the presence of a constant magnetic field.

entry.title: Lower bounds for the counting function of integral operators
entry.summary: The paper presents a lower bound for the number of negative eigenvalues of an integral operator with continuous kernel K lying below a nonpositive number t. The estimate is given in terms of some integrals of K.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Operator Theory: Advances and Applications, Vol. 228 (2013), pp. 343-354

entry.title: Weyl asymptotics of the transmission eigenvalues for a constant index of refraction
entry.summary: We prove Weyl type of asymptotic formulas for the real and the complex internal transmission eigenvalues when the domain is a ball and the index of refraction is constant.

entry.title: Localization Results for Zero Order Pseudodifferential Operators
entry.summary: We show phase space localization at suitable energies for zero order pseudodifferential operators, implying non-propagation properties for the associated evolution groups.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Pseudodifferential Operators and Applications,vol 5. no.2, June 2014, 255-276

entry.title: An upper bound for the number of eigenvalues of non-selfadjoint Schrödinger operator
entry.summary: Estimates for the total multiplicity of eigenvalues for Schr\"odinger operator are established in the case of compactly supported or exponentially decreasing complex-valued potential.

entry.title: Herbert Stahl's proof of the BMV conjecture
entry.summary: The paper contains a simplified version of Stahl's proof of a conjecture of Bessis, Moussa and Villani on the trace of matrices A+tB with Hermitean A and B.

entry.title: On the Spectral Singularities and Spectrality of the Hill Operator
entry.summary: First we study the spectral singularity at infinity and investigate the connections of the spectral singularities and the spectrality of the Hill operator. Then we consider the spectral expansion when there is not the spectral singularity at infinity.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1202.4735

entry.title: Eigenvalues collision for PT-symmetric waveguide
entry.summary: We consider a model of planar PT-symmetric waveguide and study the phenomenon of the eigenvalues collision under the perturbation of boundary conditions. This phenomenon was discovered numerically in previous works. The main result of this work is an analytic explanation of this phenomenon.

entry.title: Representation theorems and variational principles for self-adjoint operator matrices
entry.summary: In the terms of triples $D^+\to H\to D^-$ of Hilbert spaces we construct an analogue of Friedrichs's extension for operator matrices. Also we establish some general approach to construction of variational principles for such matrices.

entry.title: A new approach to spectral approximation
entry.summary: A new technique for approximating eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a self-adjoint operator is presented. The method does not incur spectral pollution, uses trial spaces from the form domain, has a self-adjoint algorithm, and exhibits superconvergence.

entry.title: Some estimates for the norm of the self-commutator
entry.summary: Different estimates for the norm of the self-commutator of a Hilbert space operator are proposed. Particularly, this norm is bounded from above by twice of the area of the numerical range of the operator. An isoperimetric-type inequality is proved.

entry.title: Waveguides with asymptotically diverging twisting
entry.summary: We provide a class of unbounded three-dimensional domains of infinite volume for which the spectrum of the associated Dirichlet Laplacian is purely discrete. The construction is based on considering tubes with asymptotically diverging twisting angle.

entry.title: A quantitative version of Gordon's Theorem for Jacobi and Sturm-Liouville operators
entry.summary: We prove a quantitative version of Gordon's Theorem concerning absence of eigenvalues for Jacobi matrices and Sturm-Liouville operators with complex coefficients.

entry.title: Poisson Statistics for Anderson Model with Singular Randomness
entry.summary: In this work we consider the Anderson model on the $d$-dimensional lattice with the single site potential having singular distribution, mainly $\alpha$-H\"older continuous ones and show that the eigenvalue statistics is Poisson in the region of exponential localization.

entry.title: On normalized differentials on hyperelliptic curves of infinite genus
entry.summary: We develop a new approach for constructing normalized differentials on hyperelliptic curves of infinite genus and obtain uniform asymptotic estimates for the distribution of their zeros.

entry.title: On the accelerants of non-self-adjoint Dirac operators
entry.summary: We prove that there is a homeomorphism between the space of accelerants and the space of potentials of non-self-adjoint Dirac operators on a finite interval.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Methods of Functional Analysis and Topology 20 (2014), no. 4; 18 pages

entry.title: Bari-Markus property for Dirac operators
entry.summary: We prove the Bari-Markus property for spectral projectors of non-self-adjoint Dirac operators on a finite interval with square-integrable matrix-valued potentials and some separated boundary conditions.

entry.title: An intrinsic characterization of semi-normal operators
entry.summary: Two necessary and sufficient conditions for an operator to be semi-normal are revealed. For a Volterra integration operator the set where the operator and its adjoint are metrically equal is described.

entry.title: An isoperimetric inequality for fundamental tones of free plates with nonzero Poisson's ratio
entry.summary: We establish a partial generalization of a prior isoperimetric inequality for the fundamental tone (first nonzero eigenvalue) of the free plate to plates of nonzero Poisson's ratio.

entry.title: An Application of Value Distribution Theory to Schroedinger Operators with Absolutely Continuous Spectrum
entry.summary: We use the "Value Distribution" theory developed by Pearson and Breimesser to obtain a sequence of functions in the eigenvalue parameter for some Sturm-Liouville problems which have the property of being "uniformly asymptotically distributed".

entry.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenfunctions of Double Layer Potentials
entry.summary: For bounded domains, eigenvalues and eigenfunctions of double layer potentials are considered. The aim of this paper is to establish some relationships between eigenvalues, eigenfunctions and the geometry of domain boundaries.

entry.title: On the Ambarzumyan's theorem for the Quasi-periodic Problem
entry.summary: We obtain the classical Ambarzumyan's theorem for the Sturm-Liouville operators $L_{t}(q)$ with $q\in L^{1}[0,1]$ and quasi-periodic boundary conditions, $t\in [0,2\pi)$, when there is not any additional condition on the potential $q$.

entry.title: Asymptotics of spectral quantities of Zakharov-Shabat operators
entry.summary: In this paper we provide new asymptotic estimates of various spectral quantities of Zakharov-Shabat operators on the circle. These estimates are uniform on bounded subsets of potentials in Sobolev spaces.

entry.title: Asymptotic behavior of singular values of the acoustic observation problem
entry.summary: We consider the problem of recovering of initial data in the IBVP for the wave-type equation in the half-space by the solution restricted to the boundary. The singular value decomposition of this problem is concerned: the asymptotics of singular values is obtained.

entry.title: Inverse Problems for Systems of Variable Order Differential Equations with Singularities on Spatial Networks
entry.summary: Variable order differential equations with non-integrable singularities are considered on spatial networks. Properties of the spectrum are established, and the solution of the inverse spectral problem is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1503.01751

entry.title: Spectral Expansion without Regularizations for the Nonself-adjoint Differential Operators with Periodic Coefficients
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the spectral expansion for the differential operator generated by ordinary differential expression of arbitrary order with periodic complex-valued coefficients. The one-dimensional Schrodinger operator with a periodic potential is investigated in detail.

entry.title: Changing gears: Isospectrality via eigenderivative transplantation
entry.summary: We introduce a new method for constructing isospectral quantum graphs that is based on transplanting derivatives of eigenfunctions. We also present simple digraphs with the same reversing zeta function, which generalizes the Bartholdi zeta function to digraphs.

entry.title: Spectral minimal partitions for a thin strip on a cylinder or a thin annulus like domain with Neumann condition
entry.summary: We analyze "Neumann" spectral minimal partitions for a thin strip on a cylinder or for the thin annulus.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of OTAMP 2010 in Operator Theory: Advances in Applications Vol. 227, p. 107-115 (2011)

entry.title: Minimal partitions for anisotropic tori
entry.summary: We analyze spectral minimal $k$-partitions for the torus. In continuation with what we have obtained for thin annuli or thin strips on a cylinder (Neumann case), we get similar results for anisotropic tori.

entry.title: Some remarks about flows of Hilbert-Schmidt operators
entry.summary: This paper deals with bracket flows of Hilbert-Schmidt operators. We establish elementary convergence results for such flows and discuss some of their consequences.

entry.title: Bounds on Multiplicities of Laplace Operator Eigenvalues on Surfaces
entry.summary: In the present paper several bounds on multiplicities of eigenvalues of the Laplacian operator on surfaces are generalized from the case of either closed surface or simply-connected planar domain to the case of a surface of positive genus with holes.

entry.title: Essential Spectral Singularities and the Spectral Expansion for the Hill Operator
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the spectral expansion for the one-dimensional Schrodinger operator with a periodic complex-valued potential. For this we consider in detail the spectral singularities and introduce new concepts as essential spectral singularities and singular quasimomenta.

entry.title: Non-Perturbative Localization with Quasiperiodic Potential in Continuous Time
entry.summary: We consider continuous one-dimensional multifrequency Schr\"odinger operators, with analytic potential, and prove Anderson localization in the regime of positive Lyapunov exponent for almost all phases and almost all Diophantine frequencies.

entry.title: A Pleijel-type theorem for the quantum harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: We prove a Pleijel-type theorem for the asymptotic behaviour of the number of nodal domains of eigenfunctions of the quantum harmonic oscillator in any dimension.

entry.title: Spectral equality for $C_0$ semigroups
entry.summary: In this paper, we give conditions for which the $C_0$ semigroups satisfies spectral equality for semiregular, essentially semiregular and semi-Fredholm spectrum. Also, we establish the spectral inclusion for B-Fredholm spectrum of a $C_0$ semigroups.

entry.title: On generalized Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization rules for operators with PT symmetry
entry.summary: We give Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization rules corresponding to quasi-eigenvalues for a 1-D h-Pseudodifferential operator with real principal symbol and verifying PT symmetry.

entry.title: $C_0$ Semigroup and Local Spectral Theory
entry.summary: In this paper, we studied some local spectral properties for a Co semigroup and its generator. Some stabilities results are also established.

entry.title: Weyl formulae for the Robin Laplacian in the semiclassical limit
entry.summary: This paper is devoted to establish semiclassical Weyl formulae for the Robin Laplacian on smooth domains in any dimension. Theirs proofs are reminiscent of the Born-Oppenheimer method.

entry.title: Eigenvalue bounds for the fractional Laplacian: A review
entry.summary: We review some recent results on eigenvalues of fractional Laplacians and fractional Schr\"odinger operators. We discuss, in particular, Lieb-Thirring inequalities and their generalizations, as well as semi-classical asymptotics.

entry.title: Transfer functions and local spectral uniqueness for Sturm-Liouville operators, canonical systems and strings
entry.summary: It is shown that transfer functions, which play a crucial role in M.G. Krein's study of inverse spectral problems, are a proper tool to formulate local spectral uniqueness conditions.

entry.title: Selfadjoint and $m$ sectorial extensions of Sturm-Liouville operators
entry.summary: The self-adjoint and $m$-sectorial extensions of coercive Sturm-Liouville operators are characterised, under minimal smoothness conditions on the coefficients of the differential expression.

entry.title: On an inverse problem for Sturm-Liouville equation
entry.summary: In this study, the theorem on necessary and sufficient conditions for the solvability of inverse problem for Sturm-Liouville operator with discontinuous coefficient is proved and the algorithm of reconstruction of potential from spectral data (eigenvalues and normalizing numbers) is given.

entry.title: Spectrum of Weighted Composition Operators Part IV: Spectrum and essential spectra of weighted composition operators in spaces of smooth functions on $[0,1]$
entry.summary: We provide a description of the spectrum and essential spectra of invertible weighted composition operators acting in some algebras of smooth functions on the interval.

entry.title: Torsional Rigidity, Isospectrality and Quantum Graphs
entry.summary: We study torsional rigidity for graph and quantum graph analogs of well-known pairs of isospectral non-isometric planar domains. We prove that such isospectral pairs are distinguished by torsional rigidity.

entry.title: Magnetic Dirichlet Laplacian with radially symmetric magnetic field
entry.summary: The aim of the paper is to derive spectral estimates on the eigenvalue moments of the magnetic Dirichlet Laplacian defined on the two-dimensional disk with a radially symmetric magnetic field.

entry.title: On the spectral properties of the Schrodinger operator with a periodic PT-symmetric potential
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the spectrum and spectrality of the one-dimensional Schrodinger operator with a periodic PT-symmetric complex-valued potential.

entry.title: Number of Eigenvalues of Non-selfadjoint Schrödinger Operators with Dilation Analytic Complex Potentials
entry.summary: In this paper, we give Lieb-Thirring type inequalities for isolated eigenvalues of $d$-dimensional non-selfadjoint Schr\"{o}dinger operators with complex-valued dilation analytic potentials. In order to derive them, we prove that isolated eigenvalues and their multiplicities are invariant under complex dilation.

entry.title: Trace formulae for Schrödinger operators with complex-valued potentials on cubic lattices
entry.summary: We consider Schr\"odinger operators with complex decaying potentials on the lattice. Using some classical results from Complex Analysis we obtain some trace formulae and using them estimate globally all zeros of the Fredholm determinant in terms of the potential.

entry.title: Neumann Cheeger constants on graphs
entry.summary: For any subgraph of a graph, the Laplacian with Neumann boundary condition was introduced by Chung and Yau [CY94]. In this paper, motivated by the Riemannian case, we introduce the Cheeger constants for Neumann problems and prove corresponding Cheeger estimates for first nontrivial eigenvalues.

entry.title: L-Borderenergetic graphs and Normalized Laplacian Energy
entry.summary: In this paper we present new L-borderenergetic graphs, this is, graphs which are L-noncospectral with Kn but have the same Laplacian energy. We also present some graphs which are noncospectral to respective normalized Laplacian energy and they have the same normalized Laplacian energy.

entry.title: Logarithmic convexity of fixed points of stochastic kernel operators
entry.summary: In this article we prove results on logaritmic convexity of fixed points of stochastic kernel operators. These results are expected to play a key role in the economic application to strategic market games.

entry.title: A general trace formula for the differential operator on a segment with the last coefficient perturbed by a finite signed measure
entry.summary: A first order trace formula is obtained for a regular differential operator perturbed by a finite signed measure multiplication operator.

entry.title: A new Improvement of Ambarzumyan's Theorem
entry.summary: We extend the classical Ambarzumyan's theorem to the quasi-periodic boundary value problems by using only a part knowledge of one spectrum. We also weaken slightly the Yurko's conditions on the first eigenvalue.

entry.title: Eigenvalues of the bilayer graphene operator with a complex valued potential
entry.summary: We study the spectrum of a system of second order differential operator perturbed by a non-selfadjoint matrix valued potential. We prove that eigenvalues of the perturbed operator are located near the edges of the spectrum of the unperturbed operator.

entry.title: On Selfadjoint Spectral Theory of Random Operators
entry.summary: In this paper spectral theorems for not necessarily continuous normal and self-adjoint random operators on a complex separable Hilbert space are proved.

entry.title: Isospectral Dirac operators
entry.summary: We give the description of self-adjoint regular Dirac operators, on $[0, \pi]$, with the same spectra.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages. Original text published in Electronic Journal of Qualitative Theory of Differential Equations, 2017, No. 4, pp. 1-9

entry.title: On Inverse Spectral Problems for Second Order Integro-differential Operators
entry.summary: Inverse spectral problems are studied for the second order integro-differential operators on a finite interval. Properties of spectral characteristic are established, and the uniqueness theorem is proved for this class of inverse problems.

entry.title: Trace formulae for Schrödinger operators on lattice
entry.summary: We consider Schr\"odinger operators with complex decaying potentials (in general, not from trace class) on the lattice. We determine trace formulae and estimate of eigenvalues and singular measure in terms of potentials. The proof is based on estimates of free resolvent and analysis of functions from Hardy space.

entry.title: On a differential operator with absent spectrum
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider spectral problem for the nth order ordinary differential operator with degenerate boundary conditions. We construct a nontrivial example of boundary value problem which has no eigenvalues.

entry.title: Eigenspaces of symmetric graphs are not typically irreducible
entry.summary: We construct rich families of Schr\"odinger operators on symmetric graphs, both quantum and combinatorial, whose spectral degeneracies are persistently larger than the maximal dimension of the representations of the symmetry group.

entry.title: First eigenvalue estimates of Dirichlet-to-Neumann operators on graphs
entry.summary: Following Escobar [Esc97] and Jammes [Jam15], we introduce two types of isoperimetric constants and give lower bound estimates for the first nontrivial eigenvalues of Dirichlet-to-Neumann operators on finite graphs with boundary respectively.

entry.title: Recovering First Order Integro-Differential Operators from Spectral Data
entry.summary: First order integro-differential operators on a finite interval are studied. Properties of spectral characteristic are established, and the uniqueness theorem is proved for the inverse problem of recovering operators from their spectral data.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1702.00788

entry.title: On a property of norming constants of Sturm-Liouville problem
entry.summary: A connection, which shows the dependence of norming constants on boundary conditions, was found using the Gelfand-Levitan method for the solution of inverse Sturm-Liouville problem.

entry.title: A Structured Inverse Spectrum Problem for Infinite Graphs and Unbounded Operators
entry.summary: Given an infinite graph $G$ on countably many vertices, and a closed, infinite set $\Lambda$ of real numbers, we prove the existence of an unbounded self-adjoint operator whose graph is $G$ and whose spectrum is $\Lambda$.

entry.title: Upper bounds on the spectral gaps of quasi-periodic Schrödinger operators with Liouville frequencies
entry.summary: We prove that the size of the spectral gaps of weakly coupled quasi-periodic Schr\"odinger operators with Liouville frequencies decays exponentially. As an application, we prove that Carleson homogeneity of the spectrum can be extended to Liouville case.

entry.title: A new kind of uniqueness theorems for inverse Sturm-Liouville problems
entry.summary: We prove Marchenko-type uniqueness theorems for inverse Sturm-Liouville problems. Moreover, we prove a generalization of Ambarzumyans theorem.

entry.title: Wave Invariants for Non-degenerate Closed Geodesics
entry.summary: This paper generalizes the methods and results of our article xxx.lanl.gov math.SP/0002036 from elliptic to general non-degenerate closed geodesics. The main purpose is to introduce a quantum Birkhoff normal form of the Laplacian at a general non-degenerate closed geodesic in the sense of V.Guillemin. Guillemin proved that the coefficients of the normal form at an elliptic closed geodesic could be determined from the wave invariants of this geodesic. We give a new proof, and extend its range to any non-degenerate closed geodesic.

entry.title: On the principal eigenvalue of a Robin problem with a large parameter
entry.summary: We study the asymptotic behaviour of the principal eigenvalue of a Robin (or generalised Neumann) problem with a large parameter in the boundary condition for the Laplacian in a piecewise smooth domain. We show that the leading asymptotic term depends only on the singularities of the boundary of the domain, and give either explicit expressions or two-sided estimates for this term in a variety of situations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages; no figures; replaces math.SP/0403179; completely re-written

entry.title: Non-variational approximation of discrete eigenvalues of self-adjoint operators
entry.summary: We establish sufficiency conditions in order to achieve approximation to discrete eigenvalues of self-adjoint operators in the second-order projection method suggested recently by Levitin and Shargorodsky, [math.SP/0212087]. We find explicit estimates for the eigenvalue error and study in detail two concrete model examples. Our results show that, unlike the majority of the standard methods, second-order projection strategies combine non-pollution and approximation at a very high level of generality.

entry.title: On Roots of Eigenpolynomials for Degenerate Exactly-Solvable Differential Operators
entry.summary: In this paper we partially settle our conjecture from [1] (math.SP/0701143) on roots of eigenpolynomials for degenerate exactly-solvable operators. Namely, for any such operator, we establish a lower bound (which supports our conjecture) for the largest modulus of the roots of its unique and monic eigenpolynomial as its degree tends to infinity. The main theorem below thus extends earlier results obtained in [1] for a more restrictive class of operators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 3 figures, submitted. Also available at http://www.math.su.se/reports/2006/10/

entry.title: On a class of non-self-adjoint periodic eigenproblems with boundary and interior singularities
entry.summary: We prove that the spectrum of a certain PT-symmetric periodic problem is purely real. Our results extend to a larger class of potentials those recently found by Brian Davies [math.SP/0702122] and John Weir [arXiv:0711.1371].
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, this final version includes correction of several typos and change of title
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Differential Equations, Volume 249, Issue 12, 15 December 2010, Pages 3081-3098

entry.title: Scattering theory for CMV matrices: uniqueness, Helson--Szegő and Strong SzegŐ theorems
entry.summary: We develop a scattering theory for CMV matrices, similar to the Faddeev--Marchenko theory. A necessary and sufficient condition is obtained for the uniqueness of the solution of the inverse scattering problem. We also obtain two sufficient conditions for the uniqueness, which are connected with the Helson--Szeg\H o and the Strong Szeg\H o theorems. The first condition is given in terms of the boundedness of a transformation operator associated to the CMV matrix. In the second case this operator has a determinant. In both cases we characterize Verblunsky parameters of the CMV matrices, corresponding spectral measures and scattering functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages, substantially revised version of arXiv:0807.4017v1 [math.SP]

entry.title: Optimization of quasi-normal eigenvalues for Krein-Nudelman strings
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to optimization of resonances for Krein strings with total mass and statical moment constraints. The problem is to design for a given $\alpha \in \R$ a string that has a resonance on the line $\alpha + \i \R$ with a minimal possible modulus of the imaginary part. We find optimal resonances and strings explicitly.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, these results were extracted in a slightly modified form from the earlier e-print arXiv:1103.4117 [math.SP] following an advise of a journal's referee
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Integral Equations and Operator Theory 75 (2013), no.2, 235--247

entry.title: Trace formulae and inverse spectral theory for Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: We extend the well-known trace formula for Hill's equation to general one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators. The new function $\xi$, which we introduce, is used to study absolutely continuous spectrum and inverse problems.

entry.title: Singular continuous spectrum is generic
entry.summary: In a variety of contexts, we prove that singular continuous spectrum is generic in the sense that for certain natural complete metric spaces of operators, those with singular spectrum are a dense $G_\delta$.

entry.title: Absolutely continuous spectrum of perturbed Stark operators
entry.summary: We prove new results on the stability of the absolutely continuous spectrum for perturbed Stark operators with decaying or satisfying certain smoothness assumption perturbation. We show that the absolutely continuous spectrum of the Stark operator is stable if the perturbing potential decays at the rate $(1+x)^{-\frac{1}{3}-\epsilon}$ or if it is continuously differentiable with derivative from the H\"older space $C_{\alpha}(R),$ with any $\alpha>0.$

entry.title: On the spectrum of second order differential operators with complex coefficients
entry.summary: The Weyl-Sims classification for a second-order ordinary differential equation with general complex coefficients is investigated. Connections are then established between the associated m-function and the spectral properties of maximal-accretive realisations of the differential expression.

entry.title: On a New Algorithm for the Computation of Enclosures for the Titchmarsh-Weyl m-Function
entry.summary: The paper reports on computation of verified enclosures for the Titchmarsh-Weyl m-function. It examines some cases in which Lohner's AWA algorithm must be suplimented by mathematical analysis.

entry.title: Convergence of regular approximations to the spectra of singular fourth order Sturm-Liouville problems
entry.summary: We prove some new results which justify the use of interval truncation as a means of regularising a singular fourth order Sturm-Liouville problem near a singular endpoint. Of particular interest are the results in the so called lim-3 case, which has no analogue in second order singular problems.

entry.title: A new algorithm for computing the asymptotic solutions of a class of linear differential systems
entry.summary: This paper reports on a new algorithm to compute the asymptotic solutions of a linear differential system. A feature of the algorithm is the ability to accommodate periodic coefficients.

entry.title: On the evaluation of the norm of an integral operator associated with the stability of one-electron atoms
entry.summary: The norm of an integral operator occurring in the partial wave decomposition of an operator B introduced by Brown and Ravenhall in a model for relativistic one-electron atoms is determined. The result implies that B is non-negative and has no eigenvalue at 0 when the nuclear charge does not exceed a specified critical value.

entry.title: The Hardy-Rellich Inequality for Polyharmonic Operators
entry.summary: The Hardy-Rellich inequality given here generalizes a Hardy inequality of Davies (1984), from the case of the Dirichlet Laplacian of a region $\Omega\subseteq\real^N$ to that of the higher order polyharmonic operators with Dirichlet boundary conditions. The inequality yields some immediate spectral information for the polyharmonic operators and also bounds on the trace of the associated semigroups and resolvents.

entry.title: A Hierarchical Method for obtaining Eigenvalue Enclusures
entry.summary: We propose a method for obtaining rigorous and accurate upper and lower bounds on the eigenvalues of ordinary and partial differential operators in bounded regions of Euclidean space. It uses a boundary condition homotopy method starting from a decomposition of the region into several simpler regions for which the eigenvalues can already be computed accurately. Several numerical examples are presented.

entry.title: Semi-classical States for Non-self-adjoint Schrodinger Operators
entry.summary: We prove that the spectrum of certain non-self-adjoint Schrodinger operators is unstable in the semi-classical limit. Similar results hold for a fixed operator in the high energy limit. The method involves the construction of approximate semi-classical modes of the operator by the JWKB method for energies far from the spectrum.

entry.title: Extremal properties of the first eigenvalue of Schrödinger-type operators
entry.summary: Given a separable, locally compact Hausdorff space $X$ and a positive Radon measure $m(dx)$ on it, we study the problem of finding the potential $V(x) \ge 0$ that maximizes the first eigenvalue of the Schr\"odinger-type operator $L+V(x)$; $L$ is the generator of a local Dirichlet form $(a, D[a])$ on $L^2(X, m(dx))$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages. Accepted for publication on Journal of Functional Analysis

entry.title: Asymptotics of the Heat Kernel on Rank 1 Locally Symmetric Spaces
entry.summary: We consider the heat kernel (and the zeta function) associated with Laplace type operators acting on a general irreducible rank 1 locally symmetric space X. The set of Minakshisundaram- Pleijel coefficients {A_k(X)}_{k=0}^{\infty} in the short-time asymptotic expansion of the heat kernel is calculated explicitly.

entry.title: A class of pseudo-differential operators with oscillating symbols
entry.summary: We study a class of pseudo-differential operators with oscillating symbols or osc illating amplitudes appearing in the long-range scattering theory. We develop the basic calc ulus for operators from such classes and solve some concrete problems posed by applications to scattering theory, especially to the scattering matrix. In particular, we show tha t under natural assumptions the spectrum of a pseudo-differential operator with an oscillating symb ol covers the unit circle.

entry.title: On the Spectrum of the Orr-Sommerfeld Equation on the semiaxis
entry.summary: The Orr-Sommerfeld equation is a spectral problem which is known to play an important role in hydrodynamic stability. For an appropriate operator theoretical realization of the equation, we will determine the essential spectrum, and calculate an enclosure of the set of all eigenvalues by elementary analytical means.

entry.title: On a new inverse spectral problem
entry.summary: The differential operators pencil recovery uniqueness theorem is proved in our article. Novelty of this result is not equation coefficient recovery, but boundary conditions coefficients recovery. We show that all conditions of the theorem are essential. We also give some interesting examples.

entry.title: A review of Hardy inequalities
entry.summary: We review the literature concerning the Hardy inequality for regions in Euclidean space and in manifolds, concentrating on the best constants. We also give applications of these inequalities to boundary decay and spectral approximation.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of the Conference in Rostock, Sept 1998, in honour of V G Maz'ya

entry.title: Sharp boundary estimates for elliptic operators
entry.summary: We prove sharp L^2 boundary decay estimates for the eigenfunctions of certain second order elliptic operators acting in a bounded region, and of their first order space derivatives, using only the Hardy inequality. We then deduce bounds on the change of the eigenvalues when the region is reduced slightly in size, subject to DBCs.

entry.title: Spectral Instability for Some Schroedinger Operators
entry.summary: We define the concept of instability index of an isolated eigenvalue of a non-self-adjoint operator, and prove some of its general properties.
